analysis.raw_analysis:
- Puzzle: input=output; sizes same (10x10,20x20,6x6)
- Visual 1: 3-outline → 4 fills (2x2 + 1x1)
- Visual 2: 3-cluster → single 4 at concavity
- Visual 3: 3-ring → central 4 block
- Visual 4: large 3-rect → filled by 4; satellites get small fills
- Visual 5: 3-cross → two interior 4 (diagonal)
- Grid1: 0/3/4; enclosed 0→4
- Grid2: 0/3/4; enclosed 0→4
- Grid3: 0/3/4; enclosed area→4
- Grid4: 0/3/4; interior cavities→4
- Grid5: 0/3/4; small hole→4

=== INPUT-INPUT COMPARISONS ===
- All inputs: color3 connected outlines/clusters with internal concavities/holes; canvas sizes preserved.
- Hole size/shape varies across examples → determines how many color4 cells appear.

=== OUTPUT-OUTPUT COMPARISONS ===
- Same in all: color3 unchanged; color4 always appears only inside/within concavities/enclosed empty regions of color3.
- MUST: fill enclosed/concave empty cells with color4; preserve color0 and color3 locations.

=== INPUT-OUTPUT COMPARISONS ===
- Ex1: fills a 2x2 hole + one small concavity with color4.
- Ex2: fills a single concave cell with color4.
- Ex3: fills the large central hollow with a contiguous color4 block.
- Ex4: fills the big rectangular hole and small satellite concavities with color4.
- Ex5: fills the 2x2 central gap with color4.

=== COLOR REFERENCE ===
- color0 background; color3 original object; color4 fill.

- Reference objects:
  - Color3 connected outlines/clusters (against color0) remain unchanged.
  - Their internal concavities/holes act as anchors: enclosed empty regions are targeted for change.

- Whole-grid patterns:
  - Color3 preserved; enclosed empty cavities become solid color4 fills.
  - Fills match the contiguous enclosed region shape (often 2x2 or larger); external isolated 3s stay.

- Object analysis:
  - Key objects: large 3-rings and smaller 3-clusters; each enclosed void → color4 block.
  - Recurring: only interior cells convert to color4; border 3s never change.

=== GENERAL RULE ===
Every connected region of color 3 is left unchanged, but any empty (color 0) cell that lies inside a concavity or fully enclosed cavity of a color-3 object is changed to color 4. Fill each contiguous enclosed/concave empty region completely with color 4 (preserve its shape and extent). Do not alter any other cells or colors.

Fill each contiguous enclosed/concave empty region completely with color 4 (preserve its shape and extent). Do not alter any other cells or colors.

general_steps.instruction: Step 1: for each (connected region of color 0 that is completely enclosed by a single connected object composed only of color 3) A, perform transition color_mapping
general_steps.condition: A connected region composed only of color 0 (size >= 1) such that there exists a single connected object composed only of color 3 for which every 4-neighbor path from any cell of this color-0 region to the grid boundary crosses that color-3 object (equivalently: the color-0 region has no 4-neighbor path to the grid edge and is surrounded by exactly one connected component whose cells are all color 3).

general_steps.instruction: Step 2: for each (connected object of color 4 that did not exist in the input and lies entirely inside the bounding region of a single connected color-3 object) A, perform transition create_objects
general_steps.condition: Any connected object composed only of color 4 in the output whose every cell was color 0 in the input (i.e., the object is new) and whose cells lie entirely within the bounding box/area of a single connected object composed only of color 3.

steps.instruction: CREATE: New object 6 (2x2 block of color 4 near the upper center (a small square).)
steps.substep_reasoning: Creating new object 6 that appears in output but not in input. This object must be added to complete the transformation.

object.description: 2x2 block of color 4 near the upper center (a small square).

steps.instruction: CREATE: New object 7 (Single cell of color 4 at row 7, column 8 (isolated).)
steps.substep_reasoning: Creating new object 7 that appears in output but not in input. This object must be added to complete the transformation.

object.description: Single cell of color 4 at row 7, column 8 (isolated).

steps.instruction: CREATE: New object 8 (Single cell of color 4 at row 8, column 4 (isolated).)
steps.substep_reasoning: Creating new object 8 that appears in output but not in input. This object must be added to complete the transformation.

object.description: Single cell of color 4 at row 8, column 4 (isolated).

steps.instruction: CREATE: New object 12 (Main 4-block: 2-column by 4-row filled rectangle (rows3–6, cols4–5))
steps.substep_reasoning: Creating new object 12 that appears in output but not in input. This object must be added to complete the transformation.
Creating new object 13 that appears in output but not in input. This object must be added to complete the transformation.

steps.instruction: CROP: Object 1 (Large, contiguous 8-connected green object spanning the top-left to the center-right region (includes the top-left cross, the top horizontal corridor, the central connectors and the large right square-like loop).)
steps.substep_reasoning: Cropping to object 1 to apply color_mapping transformation. Bbox: [1, 1, 13, 17]

Applying color_mapping to object 1 based on condition: A connected region composed only of color 0 (size >= 1) such that there exists a single connected object composed only of color 3 for which every 4-neighbor path from any cell of this color-0 region to the grid boundary crosses that color-3 object (equivalently: the color-0 region has no 4-neighbor path to the grid edge and is surrounded by exactly one connected component whose cells are all color 3).

steps.instruction: UNCROP: Object 1 back to full grid
steps.substep_reasoning: Placing transformed object 1 back into full grid at bbox [1, 1, 13, 17]

steps.instruction: CROP: Object 2 (Small left cluster of green pixels forming a cross-like pair (five connected pixels) in the lower-left area.)
steps.substep_reasoning: Cropping to object 2 to apply color_mapping transformation. Bbox: [13, 1, 15, 4]

Applying color_mapping to object 2 based on condition: A connected region composed only of color 0 (size >= 1) such that there exists a single connected object composed only of color 3 for which every 4-neighbor path from any cell of this color-0 region to the grid boundary crosses that color-3 object (equivalently: the color-0 region has no 4-neighbor path to the grid edge and is surrounded by exactly one connected component whose cells are all color 3).

steps.instruction: UNCROP: Object 2 back to full grid
steps.substep_reasoning: Placing transformed object 2 back into full grid at bbox [13, 1, 15, 4]

steps.instruction: CROP: Object 3 (Lower-right connected block of green pixels (a U/box-like structure) occupying rows 15–18 and cols 6–11.)
steps.substep_reasoning: Cropping to object 3 to apply color_mapping transformation. Bbox: [15, 6, 18, 11]

Applying color_mapping to object 3 based on condition: A connected region composed only of color 0 (size >= 1) such that there exists a single connected object composed only of color 3 for which every 4-neighbor path from any cell of this color-0 region to the grid boundary crosses that color-3 object (equivalently: the color-0 region has no 4-neighbor path to the grid edge and is surrounded by exactly one connected component whose cells are all color 3).

steps.instruction: UNCROP: Object 3 back to full grid
steps.substep_reasoning: Placing transformed object 3 back into full grid at bbox [15, 6, 18, 11]

steps.instruction: CREATE: New objects based on training patterns
steps.substep_reasoning: Creating new objects that should appear in output based on training examples.

step.instruction: Step 2: for each (connected object of color 4 that did not exist in the input and lies entirely inside the bounding region of a single connected color-3 object) A, perform transition create_objects
step.condition: Any connected object composed only of color 4 in the output whose every cell was color 0 in the input (i.e., the object is new) and whose cells lie entirely within the bounding box/area of a single connected object composed only of color 3.
